resources.string: This program uses the Needleman–Wunsch and Smith–Waterman algorithms for pairwise gene global and local alignment, respectively.

Sequence 1 and Sequence 2. 
The sequences can be entered in two different ways. 
1. String of characters. The characters allowed are "A", "T", "C", "G", "N" (ambiguous nucleotide) and "-" (gaps). 
Example: “AAATCGA”. 
2. NCBI accession number. You can enter a DNA sequence by specifying its accession number. Example: “28864546”. 

Gap Open Penalty (gop). 
By default is 10. This value can range from 0 to 20. If gop is set to 0, then the program will be using the linear gap penalty function, otherwise the program will be using the affine gap penalty function. 

Gap Extension Penalty (gex). 
By default is set to 1. gex can range from 0 to 20. If you use the affine gap penalty function (i.e. gop > 0), then gex must be less than or equal to gop.
